title: Minion
data:
A **minion** is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that serves one of the [gods](/wiki/God "God"), and appears only under specific circumstances.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"[grep](/wiki/Grep "Grep") -n minion src/\*.c to fully detail and update article, work on additional variants besides [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")"*

[ ]

## Generation

The [source code](/wiki/Source_code "Source code") in [minion.c](/wiki/Minion.c "Minion.c") controls the generation of minions. A minion is generated in these three situations:

- If you try to convert an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") and your experience level is at least 7 and also your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") close to its maximum, then there is a chance that the altar's god sends a hostile minion, regardless of if you succeed.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- If a god is [angry](/wiki/Angry "Angry") with you, either from repeated [prayer](/wiki/Pray "Pray") or praying to the wrong god, one of the possible responses is to send a hostile minion after you; this requires a level of anger just short of the worst possible smiting, which zaps you with [lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning") (and [wide-angle disintegration beam](/wiki/Wide-angle_disintegration_beam "Wide-angle disintegration beam") if the lightning fails).[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- If you are at the [Sanctum](/wiki/Sanctum "Sanctum") or on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), and you have angered a god into zapping you with lightning, then hitting you with the [wide-angle disintegration beam](/wiki/Wide-angle_disintegration_beam "Wide-angle disintegration beam") and successfully survived both, then the god will summon three minions against you.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) One way to trigger this is to attempt to convert a [high altar](/wiki/High_altar "High altar").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

The tame guardian [angel](/wiki/Angel "Angel") you can get on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") is considered a minion.

## Description

Minions are the same as any other monster of their type in terms of stats, but are named accordingly based on who they serve (e.g. "the [Angel](/wiki/Angel "Angel") of [Mitra](/wiki/Mitra "Mitra")"). The type of monster depends on the god that they serve:

- [A](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being") for [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") gods
- [E](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") (minus the [stalker](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker")) for [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") gods
- [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") for [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") gods and the unaligned [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch")

## Minion monster flag

The game also defines an internal "minion" flag, which [high priests](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") and all [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being") possess.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) The following peculiarities are associated with this flag:

- "Minion" monsters that are not "always [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful")" are normally peaceful to [co-aligned](/wiki/Co-aligned "Co-aligned") players with non-negative [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"), and hostile otherwise;[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
- They have at least [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")1.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
- They ignore [sanctuary](/wiki/Sanctuary "Sanctuary").[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

Additionally, for [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") "minions" only:

- They will typically not be generated with [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed"), negatively-[enchanted](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment"), or [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-prone items.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)
- They usually cannot be [scared](/wiki/Scare "Scare").[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

## Messages

- The voice of \<god> booms: "Thou shalt pay for thy indiscretion!"

  You attempted to convert an altar while your alignment record was near maximum and you are at least experience level 7, and that altar's god sent a hostile minion after you.

- Thou durst \<scorn/call upon> me? Then, die \<mortal/creature>!

  You have angered a god, and they sent a hostile minion after you.

- Thou cannot escape my wrath, mortal! Destroy \<him/her>, my servants!

  You have angered a god into smiting you with lightning and disintegration in Moloch's Sanctum or on the Astral Plane and survived both, and that god sent minions after you.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), your god may give you tame minions as gifts from [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice"), as well as from [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") if you are lawful.[\[13\]](#cite_note-13) Lawful characters may receive [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being") or [tengu](/wiki/Tengu "Tengu"), neutral characters may get [elementals](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") or [djinn](/wiki/Djinn "Djinn"), chaotic characters may get [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") and/or [minor demons](/wiki/Minor_demon "Minor demon"), and any character may receive a [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") of their alignment. These behave much like [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), except that they do not [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat") [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), cannot pick up additional items, and cannot be [leashed](/wiki/Leash "Leash") or [saddled](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle"); they will not turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor"), but cannot be re-[tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame") should they go feral.

Receiving minions does not increase prayer timeout or reduce the odds of [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") gifts. High-level lawful characters may receive a minion with [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") or [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane"), which will count only as a generated artifact for future sacrifice purposes. The minion you receive is a function of your level and the RNG. The following are the probabilities of obtaining each type of minion at each experience level:

Lawfuls have an overwhelming advantage in terms of minions, as they have much easier access to minions (through prayer) and gain significantly stronger minions. A level 1 lawful character can deliberately wound himself by throwing a weapon up, praying after turn 300, and have a 13% chance of getting a tame couatl - a monster with a poisonous bite and +1 enchantment resistance. At level 11 there is a 100% chance of getting a Deva, with a 1 in 4 chance of carrying a [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") (the Deva can be easily killed by bringing it near [the Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)")). Playing as a lawful thus makes a pacifist game much easier, as you have easy access to tame tengu (which are about as damaging as dogs) and possibly a couatl, and by the endgame can have a retinue of Archons, Planetars and Solars which will make the [Astral plane](/wiki/Astral_plane "Astral plane") a breeze.

#### Neutral

| 19-30            | nil                                               | nil                                             | 100%                            |

At early levels, an elemental minion can be a significant boon, but by the mid-game, neutral minions tend to be too weak to bother keeping around. Unfortunately, getting a djinni as a minion will not give you a chance at a wish, but will increase the djinni count, lowering the chance of a djinni appearing from a [smoky potion](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion"). Since minions cannot pickup weapons, and djinni are not created with weapons, your djinni will be limited in combat compared to one obtained through other means.

Chaotic minions don't tend to be useful past the early game, where a [black unicorn](/wiki/Black_unicorn "Black unicorn"), [quasit](/wiki/Quasit "Quasit"), or [shadow wolf](/wiki/Shadow_wolf "Shadow wolf") is an advantage in melee for weaker fighting roles. Most of the demons can be obtained through demon gating instead. They're available sooner this way; a pet marilith can be obtained by a doppelganger by level 7 using demon gating and #youpoly. It'll also be able to pick up and wield weapons. Most of the chaotic minions are not useful by the time you are high enough level to obtain them as a gift. The only advantage to having a minion is that it will not turn traitor, as almost all of the chaotic minions could potentially do (especially as most are inediate).

Minion

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

A minion is a monster in NetHack that serves one of the gods, and appears only under specific circumstances.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"grep -n minion src/*.c to fully detail and update article, work on additional variants besides SLASH'EM"

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Minion monster flag
  • 4 Messages
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
      • 5.1.1 Lawful
      • 5.1.2 Neutral
      • 5.1.3 Chaotic
  • 6 References

Generation

The source code in minion.c controls the generation of minions. A minion is generated in these three situations:

  • If you try to convert an altar and your experience level is at least 7 and also your alignment record close to its maximum, then there is a chance that the altar's god sends a hostile minion, regardless of if you succeed.[1][2]
  • If a god is angry with you, either from repeated prayer or praying to the wrong god, one of the possible responses is to send a hostile minion after you; this requires a level of anger just short of the worst possible smiting, which zaps you with lightning (and wide-angle disintegration beam if the lightning fails).[3]
  • If you are at the Sanctum or on the Astral Plane, and you have angered a god into zapping you with lightning, then hitting you with the wide-angle disintegration beam and successfully survived both, then the god will summon three minions against you.[4] One way to trigger this is to attempt to convert a high altar.[5]

The tame guardian angel you can get on the Astral Plane is considered a minion.

Description

Minions are the same as any other monster of their type in terms of stats, but are named accordingly based on who they serve (e.g. "the Angel of Mitra"). The type of monster depends on the god that they serve:

  • A for lawful gods
  • E (minus the stalker) for neutral gods
  • & for chaotic gods and the unaligned Moloch

Minion monster flag

The game also defines an internal "minion" flag, which high priests and all angelic beings possess.[6] The following peculiarities are associated with this flag:

  • "Minion" monsters that are not "always peaceful" are normally peaceful to co-aligned players with non-negative alignment record, and hostile otherwise;[7]
  • They have at least MC1.[8]
  • They ignore sanctuary.[9][10]

Additionally, for lawful "minions" only:

  • They will typically not be generated with cursed, negatively-enchanted, or erosion-prone items.[11]
  • They usually cannot be scared.[12]

Messages

The voice of <god> booms: "Thou shalt pay for thy indiscretion!"
You attempted to convert an altar while your alignment record was near maximum and you are at least experience level 7, and that altar's god sent a hostile minion after you.
Thou durst <scorn/call upon> me? Then, die <mortal/creature>!
You have angered a god, and they sent a hostile minion after you.
Thou cannot escape my wrath, mortal! Destroy <him/her>, my servants!
You have angered a god into smiting you with lightning and disintegration in Moloch's Sanctum or on the Astral Plane and survived both, and that god sent minions after you.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, your god may give you tame minions as gifts from sacrifice, as well as from prayer if you are lawful.[13] Lawful characters may receive angelic beings or tengu, neutral characters may get elementals or djinn, chaotic characters may get major demons and/or minor demons, and any character may receive a unicorn of their alignment. These behave much like pets, except that they do not eat corpses, cannot pick up additional items, and cannot be leashed or saddled; they will not turn traitor, but cannot be re-tamed should they go feral.

Receiving minions does not increase prayer timeout or reduce the odds of artifact gifts. High-level lawful characters may receive a minion with Sunsword or Demonbane, which will count only as a generated artifact for future sacrifice purposes. The minion you receive is a function of your level and the RNG. The following are the probabilities of obtaining each type of minion at each experience level:

Lawful

Lawfuls have an overwhelming advantage in terms of minions, as they have much easier access to minions (through prayer) and gain significantly stronger minions. A level 1 lawful character can deliberately wound himself by throwing a weapon up, praying after turn 300, and have a 13% chance of getting a tame couatl - a monster with a poisonous bite and +1 enchantment resistance. At level 11 there is a 100% chance of getting a Deva, with a 1 in 4 chance of carrying a shield of reflection (the Deva can be easily killed by bringing it near the Oracle). Playing as a lawful thus makes a pacifist game much easier, as you have easy access to tame tengu (which are about as damaging as dogs) and possibly a couatl, and by the endgame can have a retinue of Archons, Planetars and Solars which will make the Astral plane a breeze.

Neutral

Chaotic minions don't tend to be useful past the early game, where a black unicorn, quasit, or shadow wolf is an advantage in melee for weaker fighting roles. Most of the demons can be obtained through demon gating instead. They're available sooner this way; a pet marilith can be obtained by a doppelganger by level 7 using demon gating and #youpoly. It'll also be able to pick up and wield weapons. Most of the chaotic minions are not useful by the time you are high enough level to obtain them as a gift. The only advantage to having a minion is that it will not turn traitor, as almost all of the chaotic minions could potentially do (especially as most are inediate).

Chaotic minions don't tend to be useful past the early game, where a [[black unicorn]], [[quasit]], or [[shadow wolf]] is an advantage in melee for weaker fighting roles. Most of the demons can be obtained through demon gating instead. They're available sooner this way; a pet marilith can be obtained by a doppelganger by level 7 using demon gating and #youpoly. It'll also be able to pick up and wield weapons. Most of the chaotic minions are not useful by the time you are high enough level to obtain them as a gift. The only advantage to having a minion is that it will not turn traitor, as almost all of the chaotic minions could potentially do (especially as most are inediate).
